snippet: Ambassador Mark W. Lippert, being discharged five days after a knife attack, said his belief in the two countries’ bond had only been strengthened.
abstract: Mark W Lippert, American ambassador to South Korea who was attacked at a breakfast meeting five days ago, is released from Seoul hospital; Kim Ki-jong, who says he slashed Lippert's face and arm with a kitchen knife to protest joint military exercises, faces attempted murder and other charges.
lead_paragraph: Ambassador Mark W. Lippert, being discharged five days after a knife attack, said his belief in the two countries’ bond had only been strengthened.

headline.main: Leaving Hospital, U.S. Envoy Vows to Stay ‘Open and Friendly’ in South Korea
headline.print_headline: South Korea: Ambassador Is Released From Hospital
